definition: wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: Rephrase the wordings but content remains unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 重新措辞，但没对内容进行修改。

sentences.english: OK, a compromise would be to change the wording.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，一个折中的方案就是修改文字措辞。

sentences.english: Both sides still balk at his draft document's latest wording.
sentences.chinese: 双方仍就他的文件初稿里的最新措辞犹豫不决。

sentences.english: This is a carefully worded contract.
sentences.chinese: 这是一份措辞严谨的合同。

sentences.english: Guess you can justify anything with words.
sentences.chinese: 想必适当措辞可以使一切正当化。
措辞谨慎可使意义清楚。
李利措辞巧妙的对话启发了他。

sentences.english: His theory cannot be translated into simpler terms.
sentences.chinese: 他的理论不能用较为简单的措辞表达。

sentences.english: Of misapprehensions as to his language there is one which should be noticed here.
sentences.chinese: 关于对他的措辞上的误解在此有一点应该注意。

sentences.english: She rephrased the letter to give it more formality.
sentences.chinese: 她修改了函件的措辞，使它更规范一些。

sentences.english: When the government policies are expressed imprecisely, confusion results.
sentences.chinese: 政府政策的措辞含混不清就会产生混乱。

sentences.english: That night the French presidential palace issued a carefully worded statement.
sentences.chinese: 法国总统府当晚发表了一份措辞严谨的声明。

sentences.english: They came into sharp conflict over the wording of the message.
sentences.chinese: 他们就文电的措辞发生了激烈的争执。

sentences.english: They are not allowed to use those terms in a classroom.
sentences.chinese: 他们不允许使用这些措辞出现在教室里。

sentences.english: I'll return when I am free.
sentences.chinese: 等我空下来，我再回来和您措辞。

definition: wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
variant of 言辭|言辞[yan2 ci2]
to consider/to deliberate/to fill up a cup to the brim
writing style (formal)/to send an official written communication
a speech/to speak/to talk/to address/CL:個|个[ge4]
